title.narrative: PREVENTIVE AND PROMOTIVE NUTRITION SERVICES FOR ADOLESCENT GIRLS

description.narrative: Government and other partners at national and sub-national level have enhanced capacity to deliver gender-sensitive preventive and promotive nutrition services for adolescent girls and women., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: NUTRITION Outcome: Improved coverage and increased utilization of quality and equitable nutrition services for under five children, adolescent girls and mothers in most deprived provinces and areas.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GHOR GHOR PROVINCE
DOPH TAKHAR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH

sector.narrative: Adolescent health and wellbeing (including sexual and reproductive health)
Maternal nutrition, including counselling, micronutrient supplementation and dietary support
Prevention of undernutrition and micronutrient deficiencies in middle childhood and adolescence
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (nutrition of school-age children, adolescents and women)
Technical Assistance - Nutrition of adolescents and women

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and other partners at national and sub-national level have enhanced capacity to deliver gender-sensitive preventive andpromotive nutrition services for adolescent girls and women.

description.narrative: To prevent anemia and its devastating consequences among adolescent girls 10-19 years old,765,625adolescent girls in school and158,193out of school;were;reached with theWeekly Iron and Folic Acid Supplementation (WIFS).In addition, UNICEF supported capacity building of 864;health facilities’ staff in;three provinces;(Kandahar, Jawzjan, and Herat) on maternal nutrition.;;The result of theUSInational quality control campaign resulted in strengthening supportive supervision of the iodized salt at factories and market level. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
